div.p: TIME CONSISTING of a LIMITED SEQUENCE of MOMENTS.
1. The most current general term for a period of time is shí 時, but the term often retains its connotations of "seasons of the year".
2. Qī 期 refers to a designated period of time where something is supposed to happen.
rough draft to BEGIN TO identify synonym group members for analysis, based on CL etc. 18.11.2003. CH ／

bibl.title: Handbuch der lateinischen und griechischen Synonymik
Etymological Dictionary of Latin and the Other Italic Languages

note.p: aevus / aevum 'period of time; past; future' [m. (PI., Lucr., C1L); n. (mostly) o] (P1.+)
Derivatives: aetas, -atis 'age' (P1.+) < aevitas (Lex XII, Var.); aeternus 'eternal'

bibl.title: 古漢語常用詞同義詞詞典

sense.def: time period (compare sānshì 三世 past, present, future)
the period/time of N
period, generation
the contemporary age, of one's time
NUM generations
BUDDH: a time period lasting from the creation of a universe until its destruction; SANSKRIT kalpa
BUDDH: within the time period of a kalpa
BUDDH: summer training period in a Chán monastery
temporarily; for the time being
OBI: time of day 食日／時 "meal-time"
time of day 日暮 "the time of day is evening"
OBI: the ensuing ten-day-week, the next ten days
ten (days)
for the (upcoming) week

entry.def: The most current general term for a period of time is shí 時, but the term often retains its connotations of "seasons of the year".

sense.def: of the time
at this time; during this period
during the space of time of N; during the period of the predominance of N
at the period when S1
at the time; during this period
period of time
watch of the night (divided into five two-hour periods, wǔgēng 五更, the first starting at 7 p.m.)
SHI 58: agreed time; SHI 66: period of time; predicted period or time; time of an appointment
set the time on the period N
the time was given
identify a period of year according to N
BUDDH: of the three periods of time (past, present, future)
BUDDH: the three periods of time: past, present, future

bibl.title: 佛光大辭典 Fóguāng dàcídiǎn The Foguang Dictionary of Buddhism

sense.def: BUDDH: the three kalpas, referring to the past kalpa (莊嚴劫), the present kalpa (賢劫), and the future kalpa (星宿) (each of the kalpas is supposed to produce 1,000 Buddhas which are referred to as 三劫三千佛)
the third watch of the night (the period between 11 p.m. and 1 a.m.)
period of mourning

bibl.title: 佛光大辭典 Fóguāng dàcídiǎn The Foguang Dictionary of Buddhism
佛光大辭典 Fóguāng dàcídiǎn The Foguang Dictionary of Buddhism
佛光大辭典 Fóguāng dàcídiǎn The Foguang Dictionary of Buddhism

sense.def: BUDDH: the four phases/periods within a kalpa: the period of the creation of a universe (成劫), the period of the existence of a universe (住劫), the period of the destruction of a universe (壞劫), the period after a universe has been constructed and before a new universe is created (空劫)

BUDDH: a great kalpa (i.e. the time period from the creation of a universe until its destruction; a great kalpa is sometimes calculated as consisting of 80 small kalpas and lasting for 1,347,000,000 years); SANSKRIT mahākalpa
BUDDH: a small kalpa (80 small kalpa form a great kalpa, see 大劫)
after a short while/time
the times (as changing in character)
time period
destined season, preestablished proper period

BUDDH: the kalpa of emptiness (this refers to the fourth phase within a kalpa, the period after a universe has been destroyed and before a new universe is created; during this period all sentient beings of the realm of form (色界) and realm of desire (欲界) are extinguished, and everything is completely void except the fourth dhyāna heaven, 第四禪天); see also 四劫

bibl.title: 佛光大辭典 Fóguāng dàcídiǎn The Foguang Dictionary of Buddhism

sense.def: BUDDH: this refers to the present kalpa which is supposed to produce 1,000 Buddhas, Śāakuamuni being the fourth of them; skr. bhadra-kalpa
for a good while

BUDDH: three incalculable eons; three unimagineably long periods of time (referring to the period of time it takes for an unenlighened sentient being to gain the enlightenment of a Buddha; usually written 三阿僧祗劫 or 阿僧祗 ) SANSKRIT tri-kalpasaṃkheyeyaSee DDB: http://www.buddhism-dict.net/cgi-bin/xpr-ddb.pl?4e.xml+id('b4e09-963f-50e7-7947-52ab')

bibl.title: 佛光大辭典 Fóguāng dàcídiǎn The Foguang Dictionary of Buddhism

note.p: 其千人者花光佛為首。下至毘舍。於莊嚴劫得成佛道。過去千佛是也。此中千佛者拘留孫佛為首。下至樓至如來。於賢劫中次第成佛。後千佛者日光如來為首。下至須彌相。於星宿劫中當得成佛。現在十方諸佛善德如來等。亦得聞是五十三佛名故。於十方世界各得成佛。過去五十三佛名。在藥王藥上觀經。三千佛名在諸佛集功德花經。千佛名號國土種姓。父母弟子眷屬眾會年歲在賢劫經。釋迦在賢劫中千佛第四成佛祐仰惟。

sense.def: BUDDH: the future skr. Naksatra kalpa

bibl.title: 佛光大辭典 Fóguāng dàcídiǎn The Foguang Dictionary of Buddhism

sense.def: BUDDH: the past skr. Vyūha kalpa (the names of the 1,000 Buddhas of the this kalpa are listed in the Guòqù Zhuāngyán jié qiānfó míng jīng 過去莊嚴劫千佛名經)

BUDDH: incalculable eons; unimagineably long periods of time; SANSKRIT asaṃkhya kalpa (referring to the period of time it takes for an unenlighened sentient being to gain the enlightenment of a Buddha; see also 三阿僧祗劫 or 阿僧祗 ) See DDB: http://www.buddhism-dict.net/cgi-bin/xpr-ddb.pl?4e.xml+id('b4e09-963f-50e7-7947-52ab')
period; years of one's life 遐年 "later years; old age"
the period of N
of the autumn period
part of the year; period
The period of the sunrise (5-7 am)
Period 7-9 am
Mid morning, 9-11am
Midday, 11am to 1pm
Afternoon hour, 1 to 3 pm
Later afternoon, 3 - 5 pm.
Early evening, 5-7pm
Dusk hour, 7 to 9 pm
Late evening 9 - 11pm
Midnight, 11pm to 1 am
Before dawn, 1 to 3 am
the period of the 六國
=有間 for a while
During that period, at that historical stage
